SubTopics: Analyze functions that model linear relationships.
Content: What is the equation of the line graphed below?
problems/NC18G8M/media/1a.jpg

SubTopics: Compare properties of two linear functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Which graph has a slope that is 1/4 unit greater than the slope of the graph of y = x – 2?

SubTopics: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate measurement data to investigate patterns of association between two quantities. Investigate and describe patterns such as clustering, outliers, positive or negative association, linear association, and nonlinear association.
Content: Susan recorded the time she ate dinner and the number of calories she consumed during dinner for six consecutive days. The results are shown in the table.
problems/NC18G8M/media/3a.jpg
Which BEST describes the association between the time Susan ate dinner and the number of calories she consumed?

SubTopics: Understand that every number has a decimal expansion. Building upon the definition of a rational number, know that an irrational number is defined as a non-repeating, non-terminating decimal.
Content: Which choice is an irrational number?

SubTopics: Identify linear functions from tables, equations, and graphs.
Content: In which choice is y a nonlinear function of x?

SubTopics: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate quantitative data, interpreting the slope and y-intercept.
Content: Mr. Jones determined that the equation  y = 98 − 16x/5 could be used to predict his students' unit test scores, based on the number of days, x, a student was absent during the unit. What is the meaning of the y-intercept of the function?

A.Choice: A student who was not absent during the unit should score about 98.

B.Choice: A student who was not absent during the unit should score about 94.5.

C.Choice: A student's test score should increase by about 3.2 points for each day the student is absent.

D.Choice: A student's test score should decrease by about 3.2 points for each day the student is absent.

Content: What is the slope of the line that passes through the points (2, 3) and (8, 6)?

• Next, write the sequence of numeric labels in the same order as their corresponding quantities.
• This sequence of numeric labels is your answer.

SubTopics: Perform multiplication and division with numbers expressed in scientific notation to solve real-world problems, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used.
Content: A light year is defined as the distance light travels in one year. One light year is 9.46 × 10¹² kilometers. A galaxy is about 150,000 light years wide. ABOUT how many kilometers wide is the galaxy?

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: Rectangle JKLM is shown.
problems/NC18G8M/media/22a.jpg
To the nearest tenth of a centimeter, what is the distance from J to M?

SubTopics: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate quantitative data, interpreting the slope and y-intercept.
Content: The value in dollars, y, of a car x years after it was purchased can be modeled by the function y = 14,000 – 875x. What is the meaning of the y-intercept of the linear model?

A.Choice: The initial value of the car is $14,000.

B.Choice: The average value of the car is $14,000.

C.Choice: The car's value decreases by $875 each year after it was purchased.

D.Choice: The car's value decreases by $16 each year after it was purchased.

SubTopics: Understand how the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres are related and use the relationship to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: Alexis has a cylindrical trash can with a diameter of 24 cm and a height of 42 cm. What is the APPROXIMATE volume of the can?

Content: Which equation BEST models the data shown in the scatterplot below?
problems/NC18G8M/media/25a.jpg

SubTopics: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output.
Content: In which choice is y a function of x?

SubTopics: Qualitatively analyze the functional relationship between two quantities.
Content: Carly went for a walk and jog.

:ibox:• She started walking.
• After a few minutes, Carly began jogging at a faster speed than she was walking.
• Carly then got tired and slowed down to a slower speed than she was jogging.
Which graph BEST represents the distance Carly went?

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: In the figure, JLK is a right triangle, point P is the midpoint of side JK, and segment PQ is parallel to segment JL.
problems/NC18G8M/media/28a.jpg
The length of segment PK is 4 units and the length of segment PQ is 2 units. What is the APPROXIMATE perimeter of shaded triangle PQL?

SubTopics: Analyze and solve a system of two linear equations in two variables in slope-intercept form.
Content: A car rental company charges $34 per day for a rented car and $0.50 for every mile driven. A second car rental company charges $20 per day and $0.75 for every mile driven. What is the number of miles at which both companies charge the same amount for a one-day rental?

SubTopics: Understand how the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres are related and use the relationship to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: A cylindrical barrel has a height of 8 feet and a diameter of 6 feet. What is the APPROXIMATE volume of the barrel?

SubTopics: Describe the effect of dilations about the origin, translations, rotations about the origin in 90 degree increments, and reflections across the x-axis and y-axis on two-dimensional figures using coordinates.
Content: △LMN will be dilated with respect to the origin by a scale factor of 1/2.
problems/NC18G8M/media/31a.jpg
What will be the coordinates of △L′M′N′?

SubTopics: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate quantitative data, interpreting the slope and y-intercept.
Content: The scatterplot shows the amount of sunlight some tomato plants received and the amount each plant grew.
problems/NC18G8M/media/32a.jpg
What is the meaning of the slope of the trend line shown on the scatterplot?

A.Choice: A plant grows about 3 inches for every 2 hours of sunlight it receives.

B.Choice: A plant grows about 2 inches for every 3 hours of sunlight it receives.

C.Choice: A plant grows about 3 inches for every 1 hour of sunlight it receives.

D.Choice: A plant grows about 1 inch for every 3 hours of sunlight it receives.

SubTopics: Compare properties of two linear functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: The table shows the number of hours Jake studied for his math tests and his corresponding grade.
problems/NC18G8M/media/33a.jpg
Another student, Howie, increased his test scores 6 points for each hour he studied.
Which statement correctly describes the rate of change between hours studied and corresponding test scores of the two students?

A.Choice: Jake's test scores increased by 1 point more than Howie's test scores for each hour studied.

B.Choice: Jake's test scores increased by 3 points more than Howie's test scores for each hour studied.

C.Choice: Howie's test scores increased by 1 point more than Jake's test scores for each hour studied.

D.Choice: Howie's test scores increased by 3 points more than Jake's test scores for each hour studied.

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse to solve real-world and mathematical problems.

problems/NC18G8M/media/34a.jpg

SubTopics: Understand that patterns of association can also be seen in bivariate categorical data by displaying frequencies and relative frequencies in a two-way table.
Content: A group of students were asked if they are in the Math Club and if they are in the Literature Club. Partial results are shown in the table.
problems/NC18G8M/media/35a.jpg

:ibox:• Of the students in the Math Club, 67% (rounded) are not in the Literature Club.
• Of the students not in the Math Club, 78% (rounded) are not in the Literature Club.
What is the value of x + y?

Content: In which set of points is y a function of x?

SubTopics: Use numbers expressed in scientific notation to estimate very large or very small quantities and to express how many times as much one is than the other.
Content: In the expressions, x and y represent positive integers.

:ibox:expression one: 2 • 10ˣ
expression two: 4 • 10ˣ⁺ʸ
The value of expression two is 20,000 times greater than the value of expression one. What is the value of y?

SubTopics: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to find the distance between two points in a coordinate system.
Content: Segment XY is graphed in the coordinate plane.
problems/NC18G8M/media/42a.jpg
Which could be the coordinates of the third vertex, Z, of triangle XYZ so that it would have a hypotenuse with a length of √45 units?

SubTopics: Compare properties of two linear functions each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).
Content: Paula and Julia went walking. The equation y = 3x models the distance Paula walked in x hours. Julia walked at a pace one mile per hour faster than Paula. Which graph correctly models Julia's walking distance as a function of time?

SubTopics: Understand how the formulas for the volumes of cones, cylinders, and spheres are related and use the relationship to solve real-world and mathematical problems.
Content: The diameter of a sphere is 6 cm. What is the volume of the sphere?

SubTopics: Model the relationship between bivariate quantitative data.
Content: Henry made the scatterplot shown.
problems/NC18G8M/media/45a.jpg
The scatterplot shows the data points, and it also shows the linear model that Henry drew. Which statement BEST describes the linear model?

A.Choice: The linear model describes the data well because points are scattered above and below the line.

B.Choice: The linear model describes the data well because all the points are close to the line.

C.Choice: The linear model does not describe the data well because the line does not go through any of the points.

D.Choice: The linear model does not describe the data well because most of the points are located above the line.
